SENT.plain: Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis in children is increasingly recognized as diagnostic tools and clinical awareness has improved
It is a multifactorial disease where prothrombotic risk factors and predisposing clinical conditions usually in combination constitute the underlying etiology
Clinical features range from headache, seizures to comatose state
Although symptomatic treatment involving control of infections, seizures and intracranial hypertension is uniform, use of anticoagulation and local thrombolytic therapy is still controversial
Morbidity and mortality can be significant and long-term neurological sequelae include developmental delay, sensorimotor and visual deficits and epilepsy
